title: Large-Scale Web-Based Mathematics Terminology Learning Design Project for Visually Impaired University Students: Advanced Formulas, Equations, and Statistics

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level English vocabulary and web accessibility tool (WAT) experience, along with foundational mathematics understanding (equations, graphs, statistics, functions, proofs)
context.additional_context: A learning environment focused on acquiring English mathematical terminology for visually impaired professionals. Cultivates the ability to apply mathematical terms (measurement, analysis, proof, calculation, problem-solving) needed in actual research and work, while strengthening interdisciplinary application capabilities

learning_goals: Learners will acquire and apply over 500 English vocabulary terms in mathematics (formulas, equations, graphs, statistics, probability, proofs, etc.) within six months using web-based assistive technology (WAT) for calculations and problem-solving.

Learners will achieve 90% or higher semantic accuracy in mathematical terminology (variables, functions, measurements, etc.) through a voice feedback system and braille conversion features, strengthening analytical skills.

Learners will design and present the usage of mathematical terminology applicable to real research scenarios (probability calculations, statistical analysis, proof explanations, etc.) through PBL team activities, incorporating peer feedback.

resources: Mathematics Field English Terminology Dictionary Database

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
